statement:
If $a$ and $b$ are elements of a group, then both $ab$ and $ba$ have
always the same order.\
*Proof.* Let $e$ be the indentity element of the group. For $n > 1$, we
have the conditions
$$e \;=\; (ab)^n \;=\; \underbrace{(ab)(ab)\cdots(ab)}_{n} \;=\; a(ba)^{n-1}b,$$
$$a^{-1}b^{-1} \;=\; (ba)^{n-1},$$ $$(ba)^{-1} \;=\; (ba)^{n-1},$$
$$e \;=\; (ba)^n.$$ As for the infinite order, it makes the conditions
false.\
**Note.** More generally, all elements of any conjugacy class have the
same order.
